Hi Gordon,

My intention is to have the  files on disk, each file on a dir=
ectory  so later I can generate  for each file on the directory a mets.xml =

www.edu/2010/1000/pdf/=

ent.pdf

--- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups=
.com, Gordon Mohr <gojomo@...> wrote:
>
> Here at the Internet Archive, we =
essentially never 'unroll' W/ARCs to 
> hierarchical directories like this.=
 Instead, our analysis and web-access 
> all operate on the aggregate files=
, pulling ranges out (and serving them 
> via Wayback Machine installations=
) on the fly, using prebuilt indexes.
> 
> Thus we have no standard or reco=
mmended tool for doing this. Someone 
> else might.
> 
> For simple cases i=
t should be a simple tool to write. Complications can 
> arise, though, bec=
ause not all URL paths are trivially representable as 
> file-paths. If you=
r ultimate hope is to use a web browser to view the 
> files on disk, caref=
ul choice of conventions for mapping URLs to files 
> is important, and the=
 file contents may need rewriting as well to make 
> URLs relative to the f=
ile's new home.
> 
> (The externally-contributed MirrorWriterProcessor incl=
uded in Heritrix 
> is one attempt at writing web content directly to such =
filesystem 
> hierarchies, though I don't have any experience with it, so I=
 don't how 
> well it works in practice.)
> 
> - Gordon @ IA
> 
> On 2/11/1=
1 4:45 AM, virginie wrote:

acked my whole WARC-File and so I would like to write the result (issue of =

le

t.pdf
> > www.edu/2010/1002/pdf/Dokument.pdf

ment.pdf
